original: ji srid du rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu nye bar ma spyad kyi bar du de'i nyes par spyad pa'i sdig pa'i las drag cing mi 'dod la mi sdug cing yid du mi 'ong bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: gang gi tshe zhugs bar gyur ba dang / sa phyogs deng de dag las kyis byas pa'i chu srin rnams kyis bzung nas khas bub tu drangs te /

analyzed: ro nye rab tu bzhus pas thog ma nyid du khang ldugs so //

analyzed: ji ltar de dag gis gso sbyong ba rnams la blud pa de ltar lcags kyi phor pa rab tu 'bar ba'i nang nas ldud pa na /

analyzed: ji ltar sems can dmyal ba gzhan dag na med pa snying rje ba'i sgra de lta bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: des na mi dge ba'i tshogs thams cad slong bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gang chang btung ba ldud pa ni de'i rgyu mi dge bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du /

analyzed: de dag phyis thar bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: thar nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu ma skyes la /

analyzed: de mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par gal te mir skyes na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: der las kyi rnam par smin pa gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas dge slong des brtags na /

analyzed: de la srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang @318b 'thung ba ni snga ma bzhin no //

analyzed: mchog tu bya bar dka' ba skye bo mkhas pa kun gyis rab tu smad pa /

analyzed: ngan song kun gyi sgor gyur pa rnam pa du zhig gis brdzun du smra ba rdzogs par 'gyur snyam nas /

analyzed: gal te phyogs bzung ngam /

analyzed: de ltar de grub pa na nyes pa don med pa byas pa de las de gnyis kyi nang nas gcig la chad pas gcod de / gal te bsad du dogs pa'am /

analyzed: gal te gsod pa'am /

analyzed: gal te khyim 'phrog ste /

analyzed: der shin tu tshe ring bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: gang 'phrul dga'i lha rnams kyi tshe ni lha'i lo brgyad stong ngo //

analyzed: der rdzun smra ba sdig can rnams gnas so //

original: 'khor ba'i sa bon du gyur pa /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: khva'i mchu rdo rje lta bu dang / khrag dang / rkang za ba dang / me lce bcu gcig ste /

translated: These are the sixteen neighboring hells of the great Saṃjīva hell.🔽“What karmic actions cause beings to take birth in the great Saṃjīva hell? The preparatory and the actual stages of the karmic action, as well as the subsequent stage, are all to be relied upon, cultivated, and increased.

analyzed: der gnod pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te / @320a *// 'di lta ste /

analyzed: lce padma'i 'dab ma ltar shin tu 'jam pa de kha nas drangs te /

analyzed: gang lce dag la za'ang rdzun smra ba de lce de dag phyir kha'i nang du gzhug par mi nus so //

analyzed: de'i kha'i nang gi so gang yin pa de dag la so srin au lu ka la zhes bya ba byung ste /

analyzed: de'i mid pa'ang spu gri lta bu'i rlung gis 'jog par byed la /

analyzed: de'i snying yang srin bu'i mchu rab tu 'bar ba dag gis za bar byed do //

analyzed: rdzun smra ba'i lus can ni sems can dmyal ba ngu 'bod chen po'i gzhir skyes nas sreg ste /

analyzed: phyi rol tu'ang sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis kyis gnod de /
translated: “ ‘In addition, he is harmed by two kinds of external suffering.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

translated: they will, as a consequence of karmic actions to be experienced in other lives, be born as starving spirits or animals. If, due to karmic actions to be experienced in subsequent lives, they are born with the general lot in life of a human, they will be insane and poor.

original: sems rnam par g-yengs pa dang / tshe thung ba dang / dbang po ma tshang ba dang / skye bo kun gyis smad pa dang / don thams cad med pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ba mthong ngo //🔽de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: sems rnam par g-yengs pa dang / tshe thung ba dang / dbang po ma tshang ba dang / skye bo kun gyis smad pa dang / don thams cad med pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ba mthong ngo // de nas gzhan yang /
translated: They will be mentally disturbed, have short lives, have incomplete faculties, be despised by everyone, and be unfortunate in all their pursuits.

original: dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba du 'bod chen po'i 'khor la brtags na /
analyzed: dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba du 'bod chen po'i 'khor la brtags na /
translated: “The monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will next examine the neighboring regions of the great Howling Hell.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas ji ltar sems can dmyal ba du 'bod chen po'i 'khor tshor ba dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba yod pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas ji ltar sems can dmyal ba du 'bod chen po'i 'khor tshor ba dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba yod pa mthong ngo //
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then see a neighboring region of the great Howling Hell known as Boundless Torture.

original: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to take birth there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.

original: 'di ltar gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin @323b par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba byas pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin @323b par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba byas pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: He will then notice that such a birth is due to resorting to, becoming habituated to, and increasing acts of killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, and alcohol consumption, as before.

original: rdzun smra ba ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu'am /
analyzed: rdzun smra ba ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu'am /
translated: Lying is done out of a cause of desire or

original: zhe sdang gi rgyu mi bzad pas smras shing /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rgyu mi bzad pas smras shing /
translated: out of a cause of anger.

original: gzhan la'ang 'di ltar 'di ni bdag cag gi mdza' ba mchog tu sdug pa bdag cag la byams pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la'ang 'di ltar 'di ni bdag cag gi mdza' ba mchog tu sdug pa bdag cag la byams pa yin te /
translated: One tells another, ‘This is our most beloved friend, who loves us.

original: phyogs gzung bar bya yi bden par ma smra zhig ces bsgo ste /
analyzed: phyogs gzung bar bya yi bden par ma smra zhig ces bsgo ste /
translated: Take his side, but do not speak the truth.’

original: de gzengs bstod cing rab tu bkod de btsud na de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba tshor ba dpag tu med par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gzengs bstod cing rab tu bkod de btsud na de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba tshor ba dpag tu med par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one encourages, establishes, and introduces others in this way, then when one separates from one’s body, one will fall into the lower realms, into the Unrelenting Hell.

original: der gnod pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: der gnod pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: “The beings in that realm experience the following tortures.

original: gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa'i bshad pa de mtha' dag sems can dmyal ba du 'bod chen por 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa'i bshad pa de mtha' dag sems can dmyal ba du 'bod chen por 'byung ste /
translated: All the tortures of the Reviving Hell and so forth are also present in the Great Howling Hell,

original: gang las kyi rgyu lci ba'i phyir gnod pa'ang lci ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang las kyi rgyu lci ba'i phyir gnod pa'ang lci ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: but because the karmic actions of the beings there are heavy, the tortures are also heavier.

original: gnod pa lci ba nyid kyis las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yang dag par ston to //
analyzed: gnod pa lci ba nyid kyis las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yang dag par ston to //
translated: The weight of the harm shows the ripening of the karma.

original: de ltar 'di ni dus mtha' med pa nas 'jigs pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i las dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa zo chun gyi rgyun ltar 'khor ba'i 'khor lor rab tu 'jug go /
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni dus mtha' med pa nas 'jigs pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i las dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa zo chun gyi rgyun ltar 'khor ba'i 'khor lor rab tu 'jug go /
translated: Thus, this person, from beginningless time, has been in the cycle of existence, like the wheel of a water-driven oil-mill, with fear and with the afflictions.🔽It is said that of all the other sins, lying is the worst.

original: sdig pa gzhan thams cad kyi gnod pa gzhan du 'jug pa na brdzun du smra ba ni ches sdig po che yin no zhes brjod do; ;brdzun du smra ba rdzogs pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rton pa gcod par byed de /
analyzed: sdig pa gzhan thams cad kyi gnod pa gzhan du 'jug pa na brdzun du smra ba ni ches sdig po che yin no zhes brjod do; ;brdzun du smra ba rdzogs pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rton pa gcod par byed de /
translated: The completion of lying severs the roots of virtue.

original: rgyu ji lta ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu'ang de lta de ltar 'gyur te /🔽rgyu 'dis sems can dmyal ba tshor ba @324a *//
analyzed: rgyu ji lta ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu'ang de lta de ltar 'gyur te / rgyu 'dis sems can dmyal ba tshor ba @324a *//
translated: The result is just like the cause.🔽The cause of the immeasurable feeling in the hells is immeasurable feeling.

original: dpag tu med par tshor ba 'byung ba gang yin pa de dag brjod pa mi nus so //
analyzed: dpag tu med par tshor ba 'byung ba gang yin pa de dag brjod pa mi nus so //
translated: It is impossible to describe it.

original: der gnod pa ni sems can dmyal ba pa gzhan thams cad dang yang mtshungs pa med de; sems can dmyal ba pa sdig po che'i tshor ba 'byung ba ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: der gnod pa ni sems can dmyal ba pa gzhan thams cad dang yang mtshungs pa med de; sems can dmyal ba pa sdig po che'i tshor ba 'byung ba ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: The sensations of the hell beings of great evil are as follows:

original: srin bus bslad pa'i tshor ba dang / srin bu'i tshor ba dang / skom pa dang / bkres pa'i tshor ba dang / re thag chad pa'i tshor ba dang / so so'i mun nag gi sdug bsngal mtha' yas pa'i tshor ba dang / phan tshun phog pa'i tshor ba dang /
analyzed: srin bus bslad pa'i tshor ba dang / srin bu'i tshor ba dang / skom pa dang / bkres pa'i tshor ba dang / re thag chad pa'i tshor ba dang / so so'i mun nag gi sdug bsngal mtha' yas pa'i tshor ba dang / phan tshun phog pa'i tshor ba dang /
translated: the sensation of being infested with worms, the sensation of worms, the sensation of thirst, the sensation of hunger, the sensation of despair, the sensation of the infinite suffering of personal darkness, the sensation of mutual blows,

original: sgra dang / reg pa dang / ro dang / gzugs dang / dri mi 'dod pa'i tshor ba dang / tshe rabs dran pa'i dgra bgegs kyi mtshon chas rab tu gcod pa'i tshor ba dang / ba tshva'i chu bo las shin tu sgrol ba'i tshor ba dang /
analyzed: sgra dang / reg pa dang / ro dang / gzugs dang / dri mi 'dod pa'i tshor ba dang / tshe rabs dran pa'i dgra bgegs kyi mtshon chas rab tu gcod pa'i tshor ba dang / ba tshva'i chu bo las shin tu sgrol ba'i tshor ba dang /
translated: the sensation of undesirable sound, touch, taste, form, and smell, the sensation of being cut by the weapons of the enemies of the recollection of past lives, the sensation of being completely liberated from the river of salt water,

original: phur bu rnams kyis 'debs pa'i tshor ba dang / rmog thag mes bsregs pa'i tshor ba dang / rtsva dar ba ltar gcod cing rdo rjes reg pa'i tshor ba dang / kun nas me dang / tshal bsregs pa'i me 'bar ba'i phreng ba'i tshor ba ste /🔽de la sogs pa sems can dmyal ba dang mthun pa'i tshor ba ji srid du rdzun smra ba nyes par spyad pa bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du g-yang sa chen po lta bu'i rdzun gyi 'bras bu sems can dmyal bar tshor ba
analyzed: phur bu rnams kyis 'debs pa'i tshor ba dang / rmog thag mes bsregs pa'i tshor ba dang / rtsva dar ba ltar gcod cing rdo rjes reg pa'i tshor ba dang / kun nas me dang / tshal bsregs pa'i me 'bar ba'i phreng ba'i tshor ba ste / de la sogs pa sems can dmyal ba dang mthun pa'i tshor ba ji srid du rdzun smra ba nyes par spyad pa bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du g-yang sa chen po lta bu'i rdzun gyi 'bras bu sems can dmyal bar tshor ba
translated: the feeling of being struck by the kīlas, the feeling of being burned by the fire of the helmet, the feeling of being cut like grass and touched by a vajra, and the feeling of being surrounded by fire and a garland of blazing fire.🔽Thus, the hell beings experience feelings that accord with the hell realms until they have overcome, relinquished, and exhausted the misdeed of lying.

original: dpag tu med pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The result of lying is like a great abyss, and the hell beings experience immeasurable feelings.

original: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: Later, they will escape from that hell realm.

original: thar nas kyang gal te lan @324b grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu ma skyes la mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na /
analyzed: thar nas kyang gal te lan @324b grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu ma skyes la mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na /
translated: If, after being free from that hell, due to karmic actions to be experienced in other lives, they are not born as a starving spirit or an animal, and if they are born with the general lot in life of a human,

analyzed: de rdzun smra ba'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus de rtag tu nad kyis mngon par 'debs shing sker bgegs pa dang / kha nad la sogs pa 'byung la /
translated: then, as a causally concordant experiential effect of lying, they will constantly be afflicted by disease, and they will suffer from goiters, mouth diseases, and so forth.

original: dbul bar 'gyur /🔽sbyin pa po'am /
analyzed: dbul bar 'gyur / sbyin pa po'am /
translated: They will be poor.🔽When they ask for medicine from benefactors

original: sbyin bdag la sman slong ba na de yid mi ches par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyin bdag la sman slong ba na de yid mi ches par 'gyur te /
translated: or donors, the latter will not trust them,🔽thinking that they are telling lies.

original: 'di yang dag log pa smra'o snyam nas mi thob ste /
analyzed: 'di yang dag log pa smra'o snyam nas mi thob ste /

analyzed: de ni nad mi bzad pas thebs nas 'chi ba'i dus byed par mthong ngo // de nas gzhan yang /
translated: When they are afflicted by a severe disease, they will die.

analyzed: dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba du 'bod chen po'i 'khor la brtags na /
translated: “As the monk who has knowledge of the effects of the ripening of karmic actions continues to examine the regions that surround the great Howling Hell,

analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba tshor ba rtsub cing tshal bzod par dka' ba zhes bya ba mthong ngo // der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /

analyzed: rgyal po'am / blon pos bdag rang gi don du rgyal srid kyi phyir ram /
translated: Inquiring into what karmic actions may cause one to be born there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and thus perceive how some people, for the sake of their own interests, or for the sake of the kingdom,

original: nor rdzas kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: nor rdzas kyi phyir ram /
translated: or for the sake of wealth,

analyzed: srog gi phyir mngon sum du yid ches par smras la /

analyzed: shin tu mngon par gnod pa byas na /
translated: If they do so with the intention to harm,

analyzed: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba tshor ba rtsub cing tshal bzod par dka' bar skye bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: der gnod pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te / 'di lta ste / rang gi lus @325a *//
translated: “The beings in that realm experience the following tortures.🔽They are born in their own bodies,

analyzed: las las kyis byas pa'i srin bu dag skye ste /
translated: which are created by their own karmic actions.

analyzed: lus thams cad la zhugs shing gnad thams cad la zhugs la / chu rgyus thams cad gcod cing rnam par gcod de; ;sems can dmyal ba grub pa dag /

analyzed: sha thams cad za zhing /

analyzed: glo ba za la mi bzad par yongs su 'gyur ba dag /
translated: and their lungs are eaten.🔽The hell beings experience extremely intense sensations, like fire,🔽and their sensations increase greatly.🔽The extremely intense sensations, like fire, are described as follows:

analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa de ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du 'tshed do //

analyzed: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: thar nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu ma skyes la gal te mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na /
translated: If, after being free from that hell, due to karma to be experienced in other lives, they are not born as ghosts or animals, but are born with the general lot in life of humans,🔽then, as a causally concordant experiential effect of that karma, they will be born in the womb of a woman who is always sick.

analyzed: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / brdzun du smra ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas 'gyur ro //🔽'di lta ste /

translated: “If, for the sake of sugarcane, land, or other property, one lies, cheats, steals, and deceives others, then, upon separating from one’s body, one will fall into the lower realms and be born in the hell of Incessant Pain.

original: der gnod pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: der gnod pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: 'di lta ste / lcags mgar sbud pa dbugs kyis bkang ba gnyis kyis lcags rdung zhing @326a *//

analyzed: las kyis bsgrubs pa'i tsha ba thams cad kyis 'bud cing 'ju'o //

analyzed: der sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa rnams kyi tshor ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad snga ma bzhin du 'byung ba'i steng du khyad par du na tho ba dag gis kun tu btags pa na /
translated: “The beings in that realm experience all the same tortures as in the Reviving Hell, and so forth, but with the additional difference that they are struck with hammers.

original: phog ma thag tu 'chi bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: phog ma thag tu 'chi bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: As soon as they are struck, they die,

original: bteg pa dang / yang 'tsho bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: bteg pa dang / yang 'tsho bar 'gyur la /
translated: but when they are lifted up, they come back to life.

original: phog pa dang / yang 'chi bar 'gyur te; de ltar sems can dmyal ba pa dag lo 'bum phrag du mar skye zhing 'chi'o //
analyzed: phog pa dang / yang 'chi bar 'gyur te; de ltar sems can dmyal ba pa dag lo 'bum phrag du mar skye zhing 'chi'o //
translated: Thus, the beings in this hell die and are revived many hundreds of thousands of times.

original: de nyes par spyad pa'i las kyi mtha' spyad pa de las thar nas /
analyzed: de nyes par spyad pa'i las kyi mtha' spyad pa de las thar nas /
translated: Having escaped from that hell,

original: me tog autpa la'i tshal mthong ste; skyabs 'dod pa de der brgyugs pa dang / me tog autpa la dag me sngon pos shin tu gang bar gyur to //
analyzed: me tog autpa la'i tshal mthong ste; skyabs 'dod pa de der brgyugs pa dang / me tog autpa la dag me sngon pos shin tu gang bar gyur to //
translated: he sees a lotus pond and, wanting to take refuge, he runs there. But the lotuses are filled with blue flames.🔽What is the result of lying?

original: rdzun smra ba de'i 'bras bu de gang yin snyam na 'jigs sar 'gro ba'i tshong pa gsad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdzun smra ba de'i 'bras bu de gang yin snyam na 'jigs sar 'gro ba'i tshong pa gsad pa'i phyir /
translated: Some thieves, in order to kill merchants who are traveling in a dangerous place,

original: chom rkun pa gang zhig dge slong gi tshul du zhugs nas 'jigs sa na chom rkun med do zhes smras pa dang / de dag nang der dong ste phyin pa dang; rkyen des bcom pa'i las de'i 'bras bus me tog autpal gang yin pa de dag 'dab ma sngon pos gang bar zhugs pa yin te rkang pa med cing phyir 'byung bar mi nus so //
analyzed: chom rkun pa gang zhig dge slong gi tshul du zhugs nas 'jigs sa na chom rkun med do zhes smras pa dang / de dag nang der dong ste phyin pa dang; rkyen des bcom pa'i las de'i 'bras bus me tog autpal gang yin pa de dag 'dab ma sngon pos gang bar zhugs pa yin te rkang pa med cing phyir 'byung bar mi nus so //
translated: disguise themselves as monks and say, “There are no thieves in this dangerous place.” The merchants go there, and because of that condition, they are destroyed. The result of that action is that the lotuses are filled with blue flames. They enter there, but they have no legs and cannot get out.

original: de'i las kyi tshul de lta bu'i mthus de lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / mig dang bral zhing ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de @329b srid du lo 'bum phrag du mar me tog autpa la mdag mes gang ba der sreg cing 'tshed la gsod cing yang 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i las kyi tshul de lta bu'i mthus de lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / mig dang bral zhing ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de @329b srid du lo 'bum phrag du mar me tog autpa la mdag mes gang ba der sreg cing 'tshed la gsod cing yang 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: Due to the force of such karmic actions, they will be deprived of hands, feet, and eyes. Until their negative acts have been overcome, relinquished, and exhausted, they will for many hundreds of thousands of years be burned, boiled, killed, and revived in a flower of the utpala plant filled with burning coals.

original: de sems can dmyal ba de las thar par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de sems can dmyal ba de las thar par 'gyur te /
translated: “When they finally escape this hell,

original: thar nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu ma skyes la /
analyzed: thar nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu ma skyes la /
translated: if they do not take birth as a starving spirit or an animal due to karmic actions to be experienced in other lives,

original: mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na las de dang rgyu mthun pas de rtog pa po dang / g-yo thabs smra bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na las de dang rgyu mthun pas de rtog pa po dang / g-yo thabs smra bar 'gyur /
translated: they may, in accordance with their causal actions, become a fortune-teller or a deceitful speaker.

original: de'i nor rdzas bsags pa rgyal pos 'phrog gcing de'ang bcings pa'i tshe 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: de'i nor rdzas bsags pa rgyal pos 'phrog gcing de'ang bcings pa'i tshe 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: When their accumulated wealth is confiscated by the king and they are imprisoned, they will die.

original: de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang /
translated: Furthermore,

original: dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po du 'bod kyi 'khor la brtags na /
analyzed: dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po du 'bod kyi 'khor la brtags na /
translated: when the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects examines the regions that surround the Great Howling Hell,

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba chen po du 'bod kyi sems can dmyal ba gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba mthong ngo //🔽der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba chen po du 'bod kyi sems can dmyal ba gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba mthong ngo // der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des brtags na /
translated: he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and thus perceive a neighboring hell realm known as Transformation.

original: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod bas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod bas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas 'gyur ro //
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to take birth there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and thus perceive how some people kill, steal, and engage in sexual misconduct, and how they also regularly drink alcohol.

original: rdzun smra ba'ang de dbye ba'am /
analyzed: rdzun smra ba'ang de dbye ba'am /
translated: They also lie,

original: gsod pa'am / pha rol las rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir g-yo sgyu smra ba yin na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsod pa'am / pha rol las rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir g-yo sgyu smra ba yin na / 'di lta ste /
translated: and they do so in order to deceive, kill, or defeat others.

original: bdag ni rtag tu bden par smra ba yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni rtag tu bden par smra ba yin te /
translated: They think, ‘I am always truthful.

original: bdag bden pa smra'o zhes 'jig rten kun dad pa @330a *//
analyzed: bdag bden pa smra'o zhes 'jig rten kun dad pa @330a *//
translated: “I speak the truth,” he says, and thus he gains the trust of the world.

original: bskyed nas / de de'i rdzun sna tshogs smras pa gang gis yul 'khor 'joms par byed /
analyzed: bskyed nas / de de'i rdzun sna tshogs smras pa gang gis yul 'khor 'joms par byed /
translated: But then he tells all kinds of lies, and through those lies he destroys the country.

original: skyes bu dam pa gsod par byed /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa gsod par byed /
translated: He kills holy people.

original: dgra gzhan gyi nor rdzas 'phrog par byed do //
analyzed: dgra gzhan gyi nor rdzas 'phrog par byed do //
translated: He steals the wealth of others.

original: sngon bden pa smra'o zhes 'jig rten yid ches pa thob par byas shing dad pa bskyed de /
analyzed: sngon bden pa smra'o zhes 'jig rten yid ches pa thob par byas shing dad pa bskyed de /
translated: “In the past I spoke the truth,” he says, and thus he gains the trust of the world.

original: de nas rdzun smra ba ni de cha lugs bzang por bsgyur cing rkun ma rdzun smra ba yin te /
analyzed: de nas rdzun smra ba ni de cha lugs bzang por bsgyur cing rkun ma rdzun smra ba yin te /
translated: But then he tells lies, and he is a thief and a liar.

original: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba gzhan du 'gyur bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba gzhan du 'gyur bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When he later separates from his body, he falls into the lower realms, into the Saṃjīva hell.

original: der gnod pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: der gnod pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te / 'di lta ste /
translated: There he experiences the following tortures.

original: rgyang ring po nas de'i ma dang / pha dang / bran dang / bsten grogs dang / sdug pa'i mi de dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: rgyang ring po nas de'i ma dang / pha dang / bran dang / bsten grogs dang / sdug pa'i mi de dag mthong ngo //
translated: From a distance he sees his mother, his father, his servants, his friends, and his loved ones.

original: sems can dmyal ba des mthong ba dang / de dag gi kha nas tshig snyan pa dag thos pa dang / de dag gi drung du mgon 'dod pa; skyabs 'dod pa /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba des mthong ba dang / de dag gi kha nas tshig snyan pa dag thos pa dang / de dag gi drung du mgon 'dod pa; skyabs 'dod pa /
translated: When the hell beings see them, they hear pleasant words from their mouths, and they run toward them,

original: dpung gnyen 'dod pa /
analyzed: dpung gnyen 'dod pa /
translated: desiring a protector,🔽desiring refuge,

original: dpung gnyen tshol bas rgyug go /
analyzed: dpung gnyen tshol bas rgyug go /
translated: desiring a friend,🔽seeking a friend.

original: de ji lta ji ltar de dag gi drung du rgyug pa de lta de ltar ma dag me mtsho lta bu'i nang du nub ste /
analyzed: de ji lta ji ltar de dag gi drung du rgyug pa de lta de ltar ma dag me mtsho lta bu'i nang du nub ste /
translated: But the more they run toward them, the more they sink into the impure lake of fire,

original: ji ltar rdo chur bor ba bzhin du nub po //
analyzed: ji ltar rdo chur bor ba bzhin du nub po //
translated: like a stone thrown into water.

original: de nas 'byung la yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad shin tu bsregs te /
analyzed: de nas 'byung la yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad shin tu bsregs te /
translated: Then, as they emerge, all their major and minor body parts are burned.

original: tshor bas nyam thag nas du skad 'don pa na /
analyzed: tshor bas nyam thag nas du skad 'don pa na /
translated: In agony, they cry out in distress.

original: de'i pha dang / ma dang / bu dang / bsten grogs dag mthong ba dang yang rgyug go /
analyzed: de'i pha dang / ma dang / bu dang / bsten grogs dag mthong ba dang yang rgyug go /
translated: Then, when they see their parents, children, and friends, they run toward them.

original: de nas yang las kyis byas pa'i gshin rje'i mi sog le thogs pa dag lam nas byung ste /
analyzed: de nas yang las kyis byas pa'i gshin rje'i mi sog le thogs pa dag lam nas byung ste /
translated: But again, the henchmen of Yamarāja, wielding swords, appear on the road.

original: de gshin rje'i mi de dag gis bzung ngo //
analyzed: de gshin rje'i mi de dag gis bzung ngo //
translated: The henchmen of Yamarāja seize them.

original: @330b bzung nas shing bzhin du dbus gshog go /
analyzed: @330b bzung nas shing bzhin du dbus gshog go /
translated: Then, having seized it, they split it open like a log.

original: de res 'ga' de las thar na pags pa dang / rus pa tsam lus pa yan lag dang / nyid lag thams cad phug cing dral ba'i lus rma mtshan can dag gar thar thar du 'bros so //
analyzed: de res 'ga' de las thar na pags pa dang / rus pa tsam lus pa yan lag dang / nyid lag thams cad phug cing dral ba'i lus rma mtshan can dag gar thar thar du 'bros so //
translated: If, on occasion, it escapes from that, with only skin and bones remaining, its limbs and secondary limbs all pierced and torn, its body a mass of wounds, it flees wherever it can.

original: de bros na'ang gshin rje'i mi gzhan dag gis bzung ngo //
analyzed: de bros na'ang gshin rje'i mi gzhan dag gis bzung ngo //
translated: But even as it flees, other henchmen of the Lord of Death seize it.

original: bzung nas las las byung ba'i zo chun rgyud ma'i nang rdos bkang ba der de bcug go /
analyzed: bzung nas las las byung ba'i zo chun rgyud ma'i nang rdos bkang ba der de bcug go /
translated: Having seized it, they put it into a water-driven saw that has been produced by karma.

original: de nas zo chun rgyud mo rab tu 'bar ba 'khor lo ltar bskor te /
analyzed: de nas zo chun rgyud mo rab tu 'bar ba 'khor lo ltar bskor te /
translated: Then the saw, blazing and spinning like a wheel,

original: der rdzun smra ba de phye bzhin du 'thag cing phye mar rlog go /
analyzed: der rdzun smra ba de phye bzhin du 'thag cing phye mar rlog go /
translated: grinds that liar to dust as if he were straw.

original: de zo chun rgyud mo de las byung ste /
analyzed: de zo chun rgyud mo de las byung ste /
translated: Then, having come out of the water-driven saw,🔽he sees his mother, father, friends, and loved ones.

original: thar nas yang ma dang / pha dang / sten grogs dang / snying du sdug pa mthong ste /🔽mgon 'dod pa /🔽skyabs 'dod pa /
analyzed: thar nas yang ma dang / pha dang / sten grogs dang / snying du sdug pa mthong ste / mgon 'dod pa / skyabs 'dod pa /
translated: He wants a protector.🔽He wants a refuge.

original: dpung gnyen 'dod pa des /
analyzed: dpung gnyen 'dod pa des /
translated: He wants a defender.

original: de dag gi drung du brgyugs rjes su brgyugs pa dang / las kyis byas pa'i lam du phur bu dang / las kyi stag byung ste /🔽de nges bzung ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi drung du brgyugs rjes su brgyugs pa dang / las kyis byas pa'i lam du phur bu dang / las kyi stag byung ste / de nges bzung ngo //
translated: On the path created by karma, there are stakes and a man-lion of karma.

original: bzung nas khar bcug ste /
analyzed: bzung nas khar bcug ste /
translated: He is seized and put in the man-lion’s mouth.

original: de 'gram so'i bar du bcug nas phur bu rno zhing rab tu 'bar ba rnams kyis gzer nas 'dren to //
analyzed: de 'gram so'i bar du bcug nas phur bu rno zhing rab tu 'bar ba rnams kyis gzer nas 'dren to //
translated: The man-lion puts him between his teeth and pulls him out with sharp, blazing stakes.

original: de sems pa dang ldan nas rgyug pa dang / de'i rkang pa'ang gcod cing 'thub /
analyzed: de sems pa dang ldan nas rgyug pa dang / de'i rkang pa'ang gcod cing 'thub /
translated: He runs, but his legs are cut and chopped.

original: byin pa'ang gcod cing 'thub la sreg go /
analyzed: byin pa'ang gcod cing 'thub la sreg go /
translated: His thighs are cut and chopped and burned.

original: de'i yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad phug cing dral la lus bsregs shing lus nyams la rnam par nyams pa dang / rtsa dang / rgyus pa dang / rus pa dang / lus kyi lhag ma lus pa dag shin tu rgyug ste /🔽de ltar rdzun smra ba @331a *//
analyzed: de'i yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad phug cing dral la lus bsregs shing lus nyams la rnam par nyams pa dang / rtsa dang / rgyus pa dang / rus pa dang / lus kyi lhag ma lus pa dag shin tu rgyug ste / de ltar rdzun smra ba @331a *//
translated: All his major and minor body parts are pierced and torn. His body is burned and destroyed. His flesh, sinews, bones, and remaining body parts are completely destroyed.

original: kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pa'i 'bras bus rgyu dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu grub bo //
analyzed: kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pa'i 'bras bus rgyu dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu grub bo //
translated: Thus, the result of lying is the result that corresponds to the cause.🔽“

original: 'di ltar de bden par smra bar bsgrubs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bden par smra bar bsgrubs la /
translated: In this way, they are made to speak the truth.🔽Then, they are made to speak lies, to speak deceitfully, and to speak slanderously.

original: de nas rdzun smra zhing g-yo thabs smra la shur lung smra ba dag de ltar de ma dang / pha dang / sten grogs dang / snying du sdug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas rdzun smra zhing g-yo thabs smra la shur lung smra ba dag de ltar de ma dang / pha dang / sten grogs dang / snying du sdug pa mthong ngo //
translated: In this way, they see their mothers, fathers, friends, and loved ones.

original: rdzun smra ba de 'di ltar tshor ba rtsub pa /
analyzed: rdzun smra ba de 'di ltar tshor ba rtsub pa /
translated: The liars experience excruciating pain.

original: tsha ba / tshor ba rno ba /🔽mtha' yas pa dag ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du lo 'bum phrag du mar sreg go /
analyzed: tsha ba / tshor ba rno ba / mtha' yas pa dag ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du lo 'bum phrag du mar sreg go /
translated: They experience hot and sharp pain.

original: 'tshed do // gcod do //
analyzed: 'tshed do // gcod do //
translated: For many hundreds of thousands of years, they are burned, boiled, cut, and killed until finally their negative acts have been overcome, relinquished, and exhausted.

original: gsod do // de sems can dmyal ba de dag las thar par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsod do // de sems can dmyal ba de dag las thar par 'gyur te /
translated: When they escape from that hell,

original: thar nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu ma skyes la mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na /
analyzed: thar nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu ma skyes la mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na /
translated: if due to karmic actions to be experienced in other lives they are not born as a starving spirit or an animal, and if instead they are born with the general lot in life of a human,

original: las de dang rgyu mthun par de dbul zhing nad bu can dang / dman pa dang / dbang po ma tshang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: las de dang rgyu mthun par de dbul zhing nad bu can dang / dman pa dang / dbang po ma tshang bar 'gyur /
translated: In accordance with their causal actions, they will be poor, sickly, and inferior, and their faculties will be incomplete.

original: skye bo thams cad la yid mi ches shing zhe 'gras pa dang mi mthun par 'gyur /
analyzed: skye bo thams cad la yid mi ches shing zhe 'gras pa dang mi mthun par 'gyur /
translated: They will be distrusted by everyone and will be disliked and opposed.

original: de'i bsam pa thams cad mi 'grub cing log par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //🔽de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po du 'bod kyi 'khor la brtags na /
analyzed: de'i bsam pa thams cad mi 'grub cing log par 'gyur ba mthong ngo // de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po du 'bod kyi 'khor la brtags na /
translated: All their wishes will be thwarted and they will see only failure.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba kun dga' la re ba med pa zhes bya ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba kun dga' la re ba med pa zhes bya ba mthong ngo //
translated: “As the monk who has knowledge of the effects of the ripening of karmic actions continues to examine the regions that surround the great Howling Hell, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and thus perceive a neighboring realm known as No Hope for Joy.

original: der sems can @331b dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: der sems can @331b dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: Inquiring into what karmic actions may cause one to be born there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and thus perceive the following.

original: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te mang du byas pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “As for the consequences of resorting to, becoming habituated to, and increasing acts of killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, and alcohol consumption, these are as described above.

original: rdzun smra ba ni rnam pa 'di dag smra ba yin te /
analyzed: rdzun smra ba ni rnam pa 'di dag smra ba yin te /
translated: “As for lying, there are the following types of liars:

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / nad bu can dang / ltogs pa dang / dman pa dang / mgon med pa dang / bkres pa dag la nor rdzas sbyin par khas blangs pa las ma byin pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / nad bu can dang / ltogs pa dang / dman pa dang / mgon med pa dang / bkres pa dag la nor rdzas sbyin par khas blangs pa las ma byin pa yin te /
translated: Those who promise to give wealth to those who are suffering, sick, hungry, lowly, unprotected, and starving, but then do not give it;🔽those who promise to give rice, food, drink, clothes, bedding, and shelter, but then do not give it;

original: 'bras s'a lu'i bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / gos dang / mal cha dang / khyim sbyin par khas blangs pa las ma byin pa de ni rgyu des re ba med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras s'a lu'i bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / gos dang / mal cha dang / khyim sbyin par khas blangs pa las ma byin pa de ni rgyu des re ba med par 'gyur te /
translated: and those who, for such reasons, leave others without hope.

original: de lus dang bral ba'i 'og tu ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba kun dga' la re ba med pa zhes bya bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral ba'i 'og tu ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba kun dga' la re ba med pa zhes bya bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they later separate from their bodies, they will fall into the lower realms, taking birth in the hell known as No Hope.🔽“As for the consequences of resorting to, becoming habituated to, and increasing acts of killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, alcohol consumption, and lying, these are as described above.

original: der gnod pa'i rnam pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: der gnod pa'i rnam pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te; 'di lta ste /
translated: The following are the forms of harm that will occur:

translated: Whatever other activities one may have will be greatly diminished, and one’s words will not be trusted by the world.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po du 'bod kyi 'khor la brtags na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i @340a *//
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po du 'bod kyi 'khor la brtags na / des thos pa las byung ba'i @340a *//
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the regions that surround the Great Howling Hell.

original: shes pas sems can dmyal ba khva mchu rdo rje lta bu zhas bya ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes pas sems can dmyal ba khva mchu rdo rje lta bu zhas bya ba mthong ngo //
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then perceive a neighboring realm of the Great Howling Hell known as Parrot-like Beak Diamond.

original: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to take birth there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.

original: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / rdzun du smra ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms la mang du byas pas 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / rdzun du smra ba kun tu bsten cing bsgoms la mang du byas pas 'gyur te /
translated: “What are these ten? Taking life, taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, alcohol consumption, lying, slander, harsh speech, idle talk, covetousness, and ill will.

original: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba khva mchu rdo rje lta bu'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba khva mchu rdo rje lta bu'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “When one separates from one’s body, one will fall into the lower realms, taking birth in the hell of Vajra-like Beak of Crows.

original: der gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa gnod pa de dag thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽rdzun ni gang zhig dge 'dun gyi 'khor gyi nang du song nas nad kyi rkyen gyis gsos sman sbyar bar khas blangs pa las ma byin na de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba khva mchu rdo rje lta bu'i nang du
analyzed: der gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos la sogs pa gnod pa de dag thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro // rdzun ni gang zhig dge 'dun gyi 'khor gyi nang du song nas nad kyi rkyen gyis gsos sman sbyar bar khas blangs pa las ma byin na de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba khva mchu rdo rje lta bu'i nang du
translated: There one will experience all the tortures of the Reviving Hell and so forth.

original: skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “As for lying, if one has gone to the assembly of the saṅgha and promised to provide medicine for the sick but then does not do so, one will, when separating from one’s body, fall into the lower realms, taking birth in the hell of Vajra-like Beak of Crows.

original: der gnod pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: der gnod pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: “There one will experience the following tortures.

original: 'das pa'i dus su las byas pa de dag khva mchu rdo rje lta bus sha bcad cing bcad cing za'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus su las byas pa de dag khva mchu rdo rje lta bus sha bcad cing bcad cing za'o //
translated: The karma that they created in the past is consumed by the iron beak of the crow, which cuts and cuts their flesh.

original: gang gi tshe sha bcad par gyur pa'i skad cig de nyid dang / gnas de nyid du'ang ches shin tu gzhon sha can padma ltar 'jam pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sha bcad par gyur pa'i skad cig de nyid dang / gnas de nyid du'ang ches shin tu gzhon sha can padma ltar 'jam pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: As soon as the flesh is cut, in that very place and at that very moment, it grows back, tender and smooth like a lotus petal.

original: de ci nas kyang tshor ba ches drag par bya ba'i phyir de nyid phyung zhing btogs pa dang / de nas yang ches shin tu gzhon sha can sar pa gzhan dag skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ci nas kyang tshor ba ches drag par bya ba'i phyir de nyid phyung zhing btogs pa dang / de nas yang ches shin tu gzhon sha can sar pa gzhan dag skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In order to make the sensation even more intense, the flesh is torn out and plucked off, and then it grows back again, tender and fresh.

original: de ltar @340b sems can dmyal ba pa de dag lo 'bum phrag du mar khva'i mchu rdo rje lta bus za bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar @340b sems can dmyal ba pa de dag lo 'bum phrag du mar khva'i mchu rdo rje lta bus za bar byed do //
translated: In this way, the hell beings are consumed by the iron beak of the crow for many hundreds of thousands of years.

original: de nas thar ba dang / bye ma'i nang nas lcags rab tu 'bar ba 'byung la de bye ma de dag la rkang pas 'gro ste /
analyzed: de nas thar ba dang / bye ma'i nang nas lcags rab tu 'bar ba 'byung la de bye ma de dag la rkang pas 'gro ste /
translated: When they escape from there, burning iron sand appears in the sand, and they walk on it with their feet.

original: de ji ltar thal ba'ang mi mngon pa de ltar des sreg par byed do //
analyzed: de ji ltar thal ba'ang mi mngon pa de ltar des sreg par byed do //
translated: It burns them so that not even their ashes can be seen.

original: de nas langs pa dang yang thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas langs pa dang yang thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, when they rise up again, everything will happen as before.

original: gang gis rdzun de smras shing sdig pa'i rjes su smras pa rdzun smra bas brdzun zer ba smras pa de yang 'byung zhing 'byung zhing bdag nyid kyi lce'ang bdag nyid za'o //
analyzed: gang gis rdzun de smras shing sdig pa'i rjes su smras pa rdzun smra bas brdzun zer ba smras pa de yang 'byung zhing 'byung zhing bdag nyid kyi lce'ang bdag nyid za'o //
translated: The one who spoke that lie, who spoke the lie of a liar, who spoke the words of a liar, who spoke the words of a bad person, will also arise again and again, and his own tongue will eat his own body.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here is a verse:

original: bdud rtsi dang ni dug nyid dag /
analyzed: bdud rtsi dang ni dug nyid dag /
translated: “Both nectar and poison

original: mi rnams kyi ni lce la gnas //🔽bden pa smra ba bdud rtsi yin //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi ni lce la gnas // bden pa smra ba bdud rtsi yin //
translated: are present in the tongues of humans.🔽The truth is like nectar,

original: rdzun gyi tshig ni dug dang 'dra //
analyzed: rdzun gyi tshig ni dug dang 'dra //
translated: and the words of a liar are like poison.

original: gang zhig bdud rtsi mngon 'dod pa //
analyzed: gang zhig bdud rtsi mngon 'dod pa //
translated: Those who desire nectar

original: de ni rtag tu bden la gnas //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu bden la gnas //
translated: always rely on the truth.

original: gang zhig dug la mngon dga' ba //
analyzed: gang zhig dug la mngon dga' ba //
translated: Those who delight in poison

original: de ni rdzun gyi tshig la dga'//
analyzed: de ni rdzun gyi tshig la dga'//
translated: delight in the words of a liar.

original: dug gis gnod par nges med kyi //
analyzed: dug gis gnod par nges med kyi //
translated: Poison is not certain to harm,

original: rdzun du smra bas nges par 'gyur //
analyzed: rdzun du smra bas nges par 'gyur //
translated: but lying is certain to harm.

original: gang zhig rdzun ni mngon smra ba //
analyzed: gang zhig rdzun ni mngon smra ba //
translated: Those who speak obvious lies

original: skyes bu de ni 'chi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skyes bu de ni 'chi bar 'gyur //
translated: are people who will die.

original: rdzun gyis bdag la mi phan na //
analyzed: rdzun gyis bdag la mi phan na //
translated: If lying does not benefit oneself,

original: gzhan la phan par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan la phan par ga la 'gyur //
translated: How could it benefit others?

original: bdag dang gzhan gang sdug bsngal ba //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gang sdug bsngal ba //
translated: If one is miserable, whether it is oneself or another,

original: de ni mi yis ci phyir bsten //
analyzed: de ni mi yis ci phyir bsten //
translated: why would a human rely on it?

original: de ltar rdzun la bsten pa ni //
analyzed: de ltar rdzun la bsten pa ni //
translated: Thus, relying on lies

original: sdig par 'grub 'gyur te //🔽mtshon dang me dang ngam grog las //
analyzed: sdig par 'grub 'gyur te // mtshon dang me dang ngam grog las //
translated: is established as a misdeed.🔽There is no human suffering like

original: mi yi sdug bsngal de 'dra med //
analyzed: mi yi sdug bsngal de 'dra med //
translated: weapons, fire, or ravines.🔽Seeing the destruction of a single body

original: lus gcig 'phrog pa mthong ba ni; ;'chi ba dug las 'byung 'gyur te //
analyzed: lus gcig 'phrog pa mthong ba ni; ;'chi ba dug las 'byung 'gyur te //
translated: is death arising from poison.

original: tshe rabs snga phyi stong dag tu //
analyzed: tshe rabs snga phyi stong dag tu //
translated: In a thousand past and future lives,

original: rdzun gyi tshig gis chud gzon to //🔽btsun pa'i rigs la mthor byed cing //
analyzed: rdzun gyi tshig gis chud gzon to // btsun pa'i rigs la mthor byed cing //
translated: one is ruined by false speech.🔽Elevating the noble class

original: dma' ba'i rigs la rgyan du byed //🔽thar pa'i @341a *//
analyzed: dma' ba'i rigs la rgyan du byed // thar pa'i @341a *//
translated: and adorning the low class,

original: lam dag ston byed pa //
analyzed: lam dag ston byed pa //
translated: the one who shows the path to liberation

original: bden pa yin zhes mngon par brtags //
analyzed: bden pa yin zhes mngon par brtags //
translated: is considered to be the truth.

original: sems can rnams kyi rang gi las //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rang gi las //
translated: The karma of sentient beings

original: sred pas khyer bar gyur pa na //🔽gzings 'dra bden smra mchog yin zhes //
analyzed: sred pas khyer bar gyur pa na // gzings 'dra bden smra mchog yin zhes //
translated: is carried away by craving.🔽The Sugata declared that the supreme truth-speaker

original: bde bar gshegs pas bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas bka' stsal to //
translated: is like a raft.

original: 'jig rten thog ma tha ma med //
analyzed: 'jig rten thog ma tha ma med //
translated: The world has no beginning or end.

original: srid pa'i zhags pa'i dbang du song //🔽'di ltar skyabs gzhan bden pa las //
analyzed: srid pa'i zhags pa'i dbang du song // 'di ltar skyabs gzhan bden pa las //
translated: They are under the power of the noose of existence.

original: med ces chos la mkhas pas rig /🔽gcer bu mtshon gyis gcod pa ltar //
analyzed: med ces chos la mkhas pas rig / gcer bu mtshon gyis gcod pa ltar //
translated: Thus, the wise know that there is no other refuge than the truth.

original: bden pas rtag tu nyon mongs gcod //
analyzed: bden pas rtag tu nyon mongs gcod //
translated: The afflictions are always cut off by the truth,🔽like a naked person is cut by a weapon.

original: mtshon gyis btab pas ngu bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshon gyis btab pas ngu bar 'gyur //
translated: One cries out when struck by a weapon,

original: bden pas nam yang ngu ba med //
analyzed: bden pas nam yang ngu ba med //
translated: but one never cries out because of the truth.🔽The truth is called the inexhaustible treasure

original: 'jig rten gnyis la phan byed pa; ;bden pa mi zad gter zhes bya //
analyzed: 'jig rten gnyis la phan byed pa; ;bden pa mi zad gter zhes bya //
translated: that benefits the two worlds.

original: chos so cog gi khrims yin zhing //
analyzed: chos so cog gi khrims yin zhing //
translated: It is the law of all phenomena

original: nor gyi gzhi yi mchog yin no //🔽bdun pa'i yon tan rab bsgrubs pa //
analyzed: nor gyi gzhi yi mchog yin no // bdun pa'i yon tan rab bsgrubs pa //
translated: and the supreme basis of wealth.🔽The result of the arising of bliss

original: bde 'byung 'bras bu chen po yin //
analyzed: bde 'byung 'bras bu chen po yin //
translated: is the accomplishment of the qualities of the seventh.

original: blo ldan ngan g-yo rnams spongs shig /
analyzed: blo ldan ngan g-yo rnams spongs shig /
translated: The wise should abandon deceit,

original: de nyid mthong bas spangs pa yin //
analyzed: de nyid mthong bas spangs pa yin //
translated: for it is abandoned by seeing reality.

original: bden pa spangs pa'i mi dag khva mchu rdo rje lta bus ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du lo 'bum phrag du mar 'tshed do //
analyzed: bden pa spangs pa'i mi dag khva mchu rdo rje lta bus ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du lo 'bum phrag du mar 'tshed do //
translated: Those who abandon the truth are roasted with vajra-like beaks for many hundreds of thousands of years until their evil karma is destroyed, abandoned, and exhausted.

original: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar par 'gyur te /
translated: Later, they will escape that hell.

original: thar nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu ma skyes la mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na /
analyzed: thar nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu ma skyes la mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na /
translated: If, due to karmic actions to be experienced in other lives, they are not born as a starving spirit or an animal, but instead are born with the general lot in life of a human,

original: las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu tsha ba sems can dmyal @341b bar 'gro ba bden pa de dang mi mthun par gyur pa rdzun smras pas /
analyzed: las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu tsha ba sems can dmyal @341b bar 'gro ba bden pa de dang mi mthun par gyur pa rdzun smras pas /
translated: the effects of such actions will be in accordance with the cause, and they will be born in a place that is the opposite of the hot hells.

original: de rtag tu 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa mang zhing rtag tu gzhan rgyal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de rtag tu 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa mang zhing rtag tu gzhan rgyal bar 'gyur la /
translated: They will be born in a place where there is constant fighting and quarreling, and they will always be defeated by others.

original: tshig gis 'jig rten pas yid mi ches par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //🔽de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: tshig gis 'jig rten pas yid mi ches par 'gyur ba mthong ngo // de nas gzhan yang /
translated: People will not believe their words.

original: dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po du 'bod kyi 'khor la brtags na /
analyzed: dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po du 'bod kyi 'khor la brtags na /
translated: “As the monk who has knowledge of the effects of the ripening of karmic actions continues to examine the regions that surround the great Howling Hell,

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba khrag dang / rkang za ba zhes bya ba mthong ngo //🔽sems can dmyal ba khrag dang / rkang za ba der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba khrag dang / rkang za ba zhes bya ba mthong ngo // sems can dmyal ba khrag dang / rkang za ba der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: Through hearing and seeing, he saw the hell known as Blood and Marrow Eater.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i she pas brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i she pas brtags na /
translated: Inquiring into what karmic actions may cause beings to take birth there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.

original: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / rdzun smra ba byas shing bsags pas 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung ba dang / rdzun smra ba byas shing bsags pas 'gyur te /
translated: He will then notice, ‘Those who engage in and accumulate acts of killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, alcohol consumption, and lying will take birth there.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: rgyal po 'am /
analyzed: rgyal po 'am /
translated: a king,🔽a minister, or a lord may reduce the taxes owed by his subjects. When he is asked, “Did you reduce the taxes?” he will reply, “No, I did not.”

original: blon po'am / rje dpon du gyur pas dpya thang las lhag par phab la 'di ltar ngas lhag par phab pa med do zhes smra zhing dpya 'bebs na de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba khrag dang / zhag za bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blon po'am / rje dpon du gyur pas dpya thang las lhag par phab la 'di ltar ngas lhag par phab pa med do zhes smra zhing dpya 'bebs na de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba khrag dang / zhag za bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When he later separates from his body, he will fall into the lower realms, taking birth in the hell known as Blood and Marrow Eater.

original: der gnod pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /🔽'di lta ste /🔽gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos dang / thig nag la sogs par 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba'i steng du khyad par du 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: der gnod pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te / 'di lta ste / gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos dang / thig nag la sogs par 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba'i steng du khyad par du 'byung ba ni /
translated: The following harms will occur:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: In addition to the harms that occur in the Reviving Hell, the Black Line Hell, and so on, the following harms occur in particular:

original: shing rab tu 'bar ba lo ma spu gri lta bu yod par rdzun smra ba de gshin rje'i mi rnams kyis lcags kyi thag pa rab tu 'bar bdag gis bcings nas kha spub tu dbyangs so //
analyzed: shing rab tu 'bar ba lo ma spu gri lta bu yod par rdzun smra ba de gshin rje'i mi rnams kyis lcags kyi thag pa rab tu 'bar bdag gis bcings nas kha spub tu dbyangs so //
translated: The henchmen of the Lord of Death bind the liar with blazing iron ropes and hang him upside down on a tree with blazing leaves like razors.

original: kha spu ba tu dbyangs pa de'i rkang pa dag la mchu dang / sen mo rdo rje @342a *//
analyzed: kha spu ba tu dbyangs pa de'i rkang pa dag la mchu dang / sen mo rdo rje @342a *//
translated: With beaks and claws hard as vajra,

original: ltar rno ba dag gis za ste /
analyzed: ltar rno ba dag gis za ste /
translated: they eat his feet.

original: kha spub tu dbyangs pa de dag khrag 'byung ba gang yin pa de la za ba des gnas par byed do //
analyzed: kha spub tu dbyangs pa de dag khrag 'byung ba gang yin pa de la za ba des gnas par byed do //
translated: The worms that live in his feet eat the blood that flows from his feet.

original: tshor ba thams cad kyi nang nas kha zas kyi tshor ba mi bzad par bshad de /
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad kyi nang nas kha zas kyi tshor ba mi bzad par bshad de /
translated: It is explained that the feeling of eating is the most unbearable of all feelings.

original: de rang gi khrag la 'thung ngo //
analyzed: de rang gi khrag la 'thung ngo //
translated: He drinks his own blood.

original: de tshor ba gnyis dag gis yongs su gnod de me'i tshor ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: de tshor ba gnyis dag gis yongs su gnod de me'i tshor ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: He is tormented by two feelings: the feeling of fire and the feeling of hunger and thirst.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here is a verse on this:

original: ji ltar bkres shing skom pa ni //
analyzed: ji ltar bkres shing skom pa ni //
translated: Hunger and thirst

original: las kyis shin tu g-yengs pas gdungs //
analyzed: las kyis shin tu g-yengs pas gdungs //
translated: are tormented by karma.

original: de ltar sreg pas sreg min zhing //
analyzed: de ltar sreg pas sreg min zhing //
translated: They are not burned by fire🔽and are not carried away by strong winds.

original: rlung drag po yis khyer mi byed; ;de ltar lo brgya stong phrag du mar de rang gi khrag dang / rkang dag la za ste /
analyzed: rlung drag po yis khyer mi byed; ;de ltar lo brgya stong phrag du mar de rang gi khrag dang / rkang dag la za ste /
translated: In this way, for many hundreds of thousands of years, he eats his own blood and flesh.

original: 'di ltar ro smad me mchog tu tsha bas bsregs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar ro smad me mchog tu tsha bas bsregs so //
translated: Thus, the lower part of his body is burned by the most intense fire.

original: de ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du /🔽sems can dmyal ba der sreg go /
analyzed: de ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du / sems can dmyal ba der sreg go /
translated: Until his negative acts have been overcome, relinquished, and exhausted,🔽he will continue to burn in that hell.

original: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis sems can dmyal ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: When he finally escapes from that hell,

original: thar nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu ma skyes la /
analyzed: thar nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dag tu ma skyes la /
translated: if he does not take birth as a starving spirit or an animal due to karmic actions to be experienced in other lives,

original: mi rnam dang skal pa mnyam pa mir skyes na /
analyzed: mi rnam dang skal pa mnyam pa mir skyes na /
translated: If born with the general lot in life of a human,

original: las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus de dbul bar 'gyur zhig gang yid mi ches pa dang / rtag tu de'i sna nas khrag 'dzag cing so shing 'cha' ba na khrag 'byung bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //🔽de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: las de dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus de dbul bar 'gyur zhig gang yid mi ches pa dang / rtag tu de'i sna nas khrag 'dzag cing so shing 'cha' ba na khrag 'byung bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo // de nas gzhan yang /
translated: due to the causally concordant experiential effects of that karma, one will be poor. One will not be believed, and blood will always drip from one’s nose. When one chews on a tooth stick, blood will come out.

original: dge @342b slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po du 'bod kyi 'khor la brtags na /
analyzed: dge @342b slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba chen po du 'bod kyi 'khor la brtags na /

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba me lce bcu gcig pa zhes bya ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sems can dmyal ba me lce bcu gcig pa zhes bya ba mthong ngo //

analyzed: gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / chang 'thung bas 'gyur ro //
translated: He will then notice that such a birth is caused by resorting to, becoming habituated to, and increasing acts of killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, and alcohol consumption.

analyzed: rdzun smra ba ni gnyis shig rtsod pa na rgyal po'am /

analyzed: blon po'am / gzhan yid ches pa'i gnas su bya bas nor blangs sam / mdza' bshes sam /
translated: “Lying is to take wealth by deceiving a king, a minister, or someone else who is worthy of trust,🔽or to take a friend,🔽or to take a lover,🔽or to take a wife,

analyzed: 'dod chags sam /

analyzed: zhe sdang gis phyogs bzung ste / zhal ce de yon por bcad na lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba me lce bcu gcig pa der skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or to take a lover,🔽or to take a wife,🔽or to take a husband,🔽or to take a son,🔽or to take a daughter,🔽or to take a servant,
